intro: Otocalyx chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapan otocalyx, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
